alert.note: Alert for Grant (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 11 at 5:29PM PST until January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Grant County in north central Washington... * Until 600 PM PST. * At 529 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located 10 miles south of Quincy, or 26 miles west of Moses Lake, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 138 and 174. Locations impacted include... George and Gorge Amphitheatre. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
